articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Deputies executed a search warrant in Glendale after a domestic disturbance involving Corey Lange, who is prohibited from having firearms. Lange was not found, but two people with outstanding warrants were arrested. Anyone with information on Lange is asked to contact the Sheriff’s Office.
articles.title: Two Arrested During Search Warrant Operation in Glendale, Suspect Still Sought

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A three vehicle crash on Highway 38 near milepost 22 left one person dead Tuesday evening. OSP says an eastbound Buick Enclave crossed into the westbound lane and hit a Freightliner before being struck by another car. The Enclave’s driver died at the scene. One person had minor injuries.
articles.title: One Killed in Three Vehicle Crash on Highway 38 Near Scottsburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Oregon is now applying SNAP work rules statewide after federal waivers ended. Adults ages 18 to 64 without children under 14 may need to meet 80 hour monthly work requirements unless exempt. About 37,000 people are affected. ODHS urges anyone unsure about the rules to contact them.
articles.title: SNAP Work Requirements Now Apply Statewide in Oregon Starting December 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Oregon DMV is implementing major changes on January 1, 2026. SR-22 requirements for driving uninsured will drop from three years to one year, mandatory suspensions for uninsured accidents will end, and new insurer documentation rules will apply for proving coverage.
articles.title: Oregon DMV Announces Major Changes to SR-22 and Uninsured Accident Rules Beginning January 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The first shipment of wreaths for the John Pierson Memorial Wreaths Across America Event has arrived in Douglas County. Thanks to Timber Country Coca-Cola and local partners, all 7,000 wreaths will be delivered to Roseburg National Cemetery for this year’s ceremony honoring local veterans.
articles.title: First Shipment of Wreaths Arrives for the John Pierson Memorial Wreaths Across America Event - Event on Saturday

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: December 11, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Police have arrested a 21 year old Roseburg man accused of killing a four month old puppy during a FaceTime call. Investigators say blood was visible in the video, and the suspect’s girlfriend reported escalating abuse. He remains in custody on multiple felony animal abuse charges.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Arrested After Puppy Killed in Recorded FaceTime Incident

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: JosephJane Winery will close after its final sales weekend on December 13 and 14, offering major discounts as the owners retire. The Roseburg winery is also listing its vineyard estate for sale and hopes new owners will continue its long loved traditions.
articles.title: JosephJane Winery Announces Final Weekend as Owners Retire, Vineyard Estate Now for Sale

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: December 10, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg City Council unanimously approved a $453,280 purchase of new digital radios for police, selecting the General Fund to cover the cost. The upgrade prepares officers for Douglas County’s new UHF system launching in February.
articles.title: Roseburg City Council Unanimously Approves $453K Radio Purchase Ahead of Countywide Digital Upgrade

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: December 9, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Detectives are investigating a suspected fentanyl overdose that left a Green District man dead. Evidence led officers to arrest 39-year-old George Perez, who is accused of selling fentanyl shortly before the death. More charges may follow as the case continues.
articles.title: Man Arrested After Investigation Into Suspected Fentanyl-Related Death in Green District

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A single-vehicle crash on Highway 138E late Thursday night claimed the life of 30-year-old Domonik Randsome Wright of Roseburg. His Chrysler 200 left the roadway, went airborne, rolled into a field, and caught fire. He was pronounced deceased at the scene.
articles.title: Fatal Crash on Highway 138E Claims Life of Roseburg Man

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The 33rd Annual Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights at River Forks Park brings families together with thousands of displays, the Holiday Village, and the world’s largest nutcracker, all supporting Rotary’s 10,000 dollar annual student scholarship.
articles.title: 33rd Annual Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights & Holiday Village

articles.description: A disturbing case of animal abuse has emerged in Douglas County, where a man is accused of killing a four-month-old puppy.
articles.title: Roseburg man arrested for allegedly killing puppy on FaceTime

articles.author: Ryan Bonham
articles.description: A 30-year-old Roseburg man died in a single-vehicle crash on Thursday evening near Glide, according to the Oregon State Police.
articles.title: Roseburg man dies in single-vehicle  Douglas County crash near Glide

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: A suspicious death in the Green District has led to the arrest of a Roseburg resident in connection with a possible fentanyl overdose, according to the Douglas County Sheriff's Office.
articles.title: Death investigation leads to fentanyl arrest in Douglas County
